summary: Built Rite Creations is a Vite + React + Tailwind single-page marketing website for a laser-cleaning services company. It uses TanStack Router with hash-based history to work on traditional static hosting without server-side rewrite rules. The site provides static content pages (Home, Services, Gallery, About, Contact) built with shadcn/ui components and a token-based Tailwind theme. The Contact page contains a client-side validated quote request form that generates a prefilled mailto: link (static-host-friendly) for users to send via their own email client. The repository also includes Internet Computer scaffolding (Internet Identity auth context, identity-aware actor creation hook, and an empty Motoko canister) for potential future backend integration, though the current site operates as a static frontend.

architectural_notes: Frontend is a Vite-powered React SPA with client-side routing via TanStack Router and a shared layout (SiteLayout) using <Outlet /> for nested route rendering.
Routing uses hash history (createHashHistory) so refresh/direct links work on static hosts without rewrite rules (URLs like /#/services).
UI is composed with shadcn/ui primitives (Button, Card, Input, Textarea, Sheet, Alert) plus Tailwind utility classes and lucide/react-icons iconography.
Design system is tokenized via CSS variables (OKLCH values) mapped into Tailwind theme colors; dark mode is supported via the 'class' strategy.
Per-page document title is handled by a custom hook (useDocumentTitle) that appends “| Built Rite Creations” and restores the prior title on unmount.

App root mounts global providers for TanStack React Query (QueryClientProvider) and Internet Identity (InternetIdentityProvider), enabling future authenticated backend calls even though current pages are static.

Internet Computer integration is abstracted behind hooks: useInternetIdentity manages auth state and persistence; useActor creates/caches an authenticated or anonymous actor and invalidates dependent React Query caches when identity changes.
Build output is configured for static hosting (Vite base './', dist output, assets folder).
Contact/quote submission avoids backend dependencies by preparing a URL-encoded mailto link and presenting a success state UI after validation.
Business contact details are centralized in a single businessInfo module and reused across pages/components.
known_issues: Gallery page uses placeholder media blocks (“Project Image”) rather than real portfolio images/assets.
Social links are generic platform URLs (facebook.com/instagram.com/youtube.com) rather than company-specific profiles.

Two global CSS files exist (frontend/index.css and frontend/src/index.css) with different token sets; only src/index.css is imported in main.tsx, so the extra file can cause confusion or accidental divergence.
TRADITIONAL_HOSTING_GUIDE.md ends with an incomplete “Local Testing (Optional)” section.
Contact form submission relies on the visitor having a configured email client that can handle mailto links; this may not work well on some devices/browsers.

useInternetIdentity.ts references process.env.II_URL for the identity provider; in Vite, environment variables are typically read via import.meta.env, so configuration may be fragile depending on build tooling.
Motoko backend canister (backend/main.mo) is an empty actor with no methods; no functional backend APIs are implemented.
Site still displays incorrect phone number "(844) 527-3733" in at least one location; needs replacement with "(781) 227-0994" everywhere.
